Explanations about Options.-r:
This option causes modprobe to remove rather than insert a module. If the modules it
 depends on are also unused, modprobe will try to remove them too. Unlike insertion,
 more than one module can be specified on the command line (it does not make sense to
 specify module parameters when removing modules).

Top-3 Similar Questions: su_1515749: Ubuntu icons disappear and everything freezes
Top-3 Scripts:
su_1515749: smartctl -i /dev/sda

smartctl -s on /dev/sda

smartctl -t long /dev/sda

smartctl -l selftest /dev/sda
smartctl -a /dev/sda
smartctl -H /dev/sda

Explanations about Options.-l:
TYPE, --log=TYPE
 Prints various device logs. The valid arguments to this option are:
Explanations about Options.-a:
Prints all SMART information about the disk, or TapeAlert information about the
 tape drive or changer. For ATA devices this is equivalent to
 '-H -i -c -A -l error -l selftest -l selective'
 and for SCSI, this is equivalent to
 '-H -i -A -l error -l selftest'.
 For NVMe, this is equivalent to
 '-H -i -c -A -l error'.
 Note that for ATA disks this does not enable the non-SMART options and the SMART
 options which require support for 48-bit ATA commands.
Explanations about Options.-H: Prints the health status of the device or pending TapeAlert messages.
